1.2. sqv.ticker.TickerSearch¶

class sqv.ticker.TickerSearch
classmethod __init__(self)¶
base¶
Type

str

The template for the address to the MarketWatch Ticker Lookup tool

address¶
Type

str

The address to the specific search

exception sqv.ticker.TickerSearch.OptionNotFoundError(Exception, field, option, options)¶
Parameters

  • field (str) – The search query field which the user attempted to modify

  • option (str) – The option which the user tried to set the field argument to

  • options (list) – A list of options (titlecase) to which the field argument can be set to

Raised when a search query field cannot be set to the passed option.

exception sqv.ticker.TickerSearch.ParsingError(Exception)¶

Raised when a resulting search query page cannot be parsed for the contained data. There are two common scenarios in which this error is raised:

  1. The name argument passed is a valid ticker, causing the page to redirect to the stock quote

  2. The search criteria result in no results.

classmethod search(self, *, name, country='United States', security='All')¶
Parameters

  • name (str) – The search term

  • country (str) – The country of the security

  • security (str) – The type of security

Raises

sqv.ticker.TickerSearch.OptionNotFoundError – If urllib.request.urlopen(self.address).getcode() does not equal 200

The address of base is formatted according to the arguments passed and stored in address. The placeholders are replaced, in order, with the following values:

  1. '+'.join(name.split(' '))

  2. the value in COUNTRY with corresponds to country

  3. the value in SECURITY with corresponds to security

The status code of the return value of passing address to urllib.request.urlopen is checked to verify search.

classmethod retrieve(self, *, limit=None)¶
Parameters

limit (int) – The maximum length of the returned dictionary, or, when None, all results will be returned

Returns

A dictionary of nested dictionaries containing the data in the table returned by the search query

Return type

dict

Raises

sqv.ticker.TickerSearch.ParsingError – If the webpage resulting from the search query cannot be parsed for ticker data

Parses the current page to extract the data contained in the table returned by the search query. Data is ordered in the dictionary A-Z-a-z.

classmethod match(self, *, name)¶
Parameters

name (str) – The search term

Returns

The name of the best match and the corresponding dictionary of the best match

Return type

tuple

Calls retrieve() for a dictionary of possible matches (results). Calls the extractOne function of the fuzzywuzzy.process, passing name (titlecase) and list(results).
